title: How to Install Car Mods in Grand Theft Auto San Andreas

steps.title: Download
steps.content: Download the San Andreas Mod Installer (SAMI) installation files. SAMI allows you to install just about any GTA San Andreas mod, including new cars, with just a few clicks. [1] X Research source You can download the installer from gtainside.com/en/sanandreas/tools/5604-san-andreas-mod-installer/ . Click the Download button to download the RAR file containing the installer.

steps.title: Extract the SAMI RAR file.
steps.content: Extract the SAMI RAR file. You'll need a program like WinRAR or 7-Zip to extract the files from the RAR file you downloaded. 7-Zip is the most popular free option, and you can download it from 7-zip.org . After installing 7-Zip, right-click on the RAR file and select "7-Zip" â†’ "Extract Files..." This will extract the files into a new folder in your current directory.

steps.title: Install SAMI.
steps.content: Install SAMI. Run the San Andreas Mod Installer v1.2.exe file and confirm that you want to run it. You can leave the installation settings at their defaults. After installation, you'll see a San Andreas Mod Installer shortcut on your desktop. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Download and install the Microsoft .NET Framework.
steps.content: Download and install the Microsoft .NET Framework. This is required for SAMI to run. Run the "dotnetfx" program after downloading and follow the prompts to install it. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Download the car you want to add to GTA SA.
steps.content: Download the car you want to add to GTA SA. Now that you have your mod installer ready to go, you can download a car mod. Car mods will download in ZIP or RAR format, which you don't need to worry about extracting. There are several places you can download car mods from, including: gtainside.com nexusmods.com/gtasanandreas gtaall.com gta-modding.com

steps.title: Start SAMI.
steps.content: Start SAMI. Once you have a car mod or two downloaded, launch SAMI to add them to San Andreas. You can find a shortcut for SAMI on your desktop.

steps.title: Click "Install a Mod."
steps.content: Click "Install a Mod." This will open a new screen.

steps.title: Click "Detect" underneath the San Andreas Directory field.
steps.content: Click "Detect" underneath the San Andreas Directory field. This will scan your system for your GTA SA game directory so that you don't need to add it manually. If the game directory cannot be detected, use the "Browse" button to navigate your computer and select it.

steps.title: Ensure "ZIP\RAR File" is selected.
steps.content: Ensure "ZIP\RAR File" is selected. This will tell SAMI to load the mod you select directly from the archive file.

steps.title: Click the "Browse" button in the "Mod Location" section.
steps.content: Click the "Browse" button in the "Mod Location" section. This will open a file browser.

steps.title: Select the car mod ZIP or RAR file you downloaded.
steps.content: Select the car mod ZIP or RAR file you downloaded. You'll usually find this in your Downloads folder, though you may have moved it elsewhere.

steps.title: Click "Continue" and then "Continue."
steps.content: Click "Continue" and then "Continue." You'll be shown the lines of code that will be changed, which you can just proceed past.

steps.title: Enter a custom name for the vehicle.
steps.content: Enter a custom name for the vehicle. You can use the name of the mod, or enter any name you'd like to use for the car.

steps.title: Select the vehicle that you'll be replacing.
steps.content: Select the vehicle that you'll be replacing. Vehicle mods have to be assigned to an existing vehicle slot in the game. Make sure you select the same type of vehicle (for example, you can't replace a boat with a car).

steps.title: Click "Install" to install the mod.
steps.content: Click "Install" to install the mod. The mod you install will replace all instances of the selected vehicle in your game.

steps.title: Start San Andreas and find your new car.
steps.content: Start San Andreas and find your new car. After installing your car mod, you can load up San Andreas and find it in your game. The mod replaces all instances of the original vehicle with the mod, so you can narrow down your search if the vehicle normally appears in certain areas. You can use a car spawner mod to instantly spawn whichever vehicle you'd like. See the next section for details.

steps.title: Download CLEO for GTA SA.
steps.content: Download CLEO for GTA SA. Visit cleo.li/ and download the GTA San Andreas version. If you add a lot of different cars to your game, you can make things easier by installing a car spawner. This will allow you to instantly call up any vehicle that you want to use.

steps.title: Run the CLEO installer.
steps.content: Run the CLEO installer. You'll need to indicate where GTA SA is installed during the CLEA installation.

steps.title: Download a Vehicle Spawner CLEO script.
steps.content: Download a Vehicle Spawner CLEO script. You can get one of the most popular ones at zazmahall.de/ZAZGTASANATORIUM/zazmoddat00100/VehicleSpawnerPremium.htm . After downloading it, double-click the file to view its contents. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Open the "cleo" folder that's been added to your GTA installation directory.
steps.content: Open the "cleo" folder that's been added to your GTA installation directory. You'll find this in your base GTA SA installation folder.

steps.title: Copy the vehicle spawner files.
steps.content: Copy the vehicle spawner files. Drag the CS file from the spawner download into this folder, and then the TXT file that was included into the "cleo_text" folder. This will install the vehicle spawner mod.

steps.title: Start San Andreas and press .
steps.content: Start San Andreas and press . 7 . This will open the Vehicle Spawner menu, allowing you to select the car you want to spawn. You'll need to select whichever car you replaced with the car mod in order to load your new mod. For example, if you replaced the Cheetah with an Audi, you'll need to select the Cheetah from the menu.
